bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 165, Number 170 (Monday, October 28, 2019)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. LYNCH:H.R. 4879.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Art. I, Section 8, Clause 18.[Page H8540]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text:
Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency Support Act

This bill provides that an officer or employee of the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency who is traveling on or conducting an accounting and recovery mission is exempt from furlough, including in the case of a government shutdown.

bill.title: Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency Support Act

item.title: Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency Support Act
To exempt certain officers and employees of the Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency from furlough, and for other purposes.
Defense POW/MIA Accounting Agency Support Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
